member.name: T:Nest.Dispatcher
member.summary: Raw operations with elasticsearch

member.name: F:Nest.ActionExecutionMode.Simulate
member.summary: The action will be simulated (not actually executed) and it will be throttled if needed.

member.name: F:Nest.ActionExecutionMode.ForceSimulate
member.summary: The action will be simulated (not actually executed) and it will not be throttled.

member.name: F:Nest.ActionExecutionMode.Execute
member.summary: The action will be executed and it will be throttled if needed.

member.name: F:Nest.ActionExecutionMode.ForceExecute
member.summary: The action will be executed and it will not be throttled.

member.name: F:Nest.ActionExecutionMode.Skip
member.summary: The action will be skipped (it won't be executed nor simulated) - effectively it will be forcefully throttled

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.TriggerEvent
member.summary: This structure will be parsed as a trigger event and used for the watch execution.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.IgnoreCondition
member.summary: If this is set to true the watch execution will use the Always Condition.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.RecordExecution
member.summary: If this is set to true the WatchRecord generated by executing the watch will be persisted to the .watch_history index for the current time. Also the Watch.Status will be updated, possbily throttling subsequent executions.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.IgnoreThrottle
member.summary: If this is set to true the watch execution will ignore throttling.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.AlternativeInput
member.summary: If this structure is present, the watch will not execute itâ€™s own input but will use these fields as a payload instead.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.SimulatedActions
member.summary: This field can either be a list of action ids or the string _all. If _all is set or an action that is executed by the watch appears in this list it will be executed in simulated mode.

member.name: M:Nest.WatcherClientExtensions.WatcherAckWatch``1(Elasticsearch.Net.IElasticsearchClient,System.String,System.Func{Nest.AcknowledgeWatchRequestParameters,Nest.AcknowledgeWatchRequestParameters})
member.summary:
Represents a PUT on /_watcher/watch/{id}/_ack
Returns: ElasticsearchResponse<T> holding the reponse body deserialized as T.
- If T is of type byte[] deserialization will be shortcircuited
- If T is of type VoidResponse the response stream will be ignored completely
See also: http://www.elastic.co/guide/en/watcher/current/appendix-api-ack-watch.html
member.param: Watch ID

Optional function to specify any additional request parameters
Querystring values, connection configuration specific to this request, deserialization state.
member.returns:
ElasticsearchResponse<T> holding the reponse body deserialized as T.
- If T is of type byte[] deserialization will be shortcircuited
- If T is of type VoidResponse the response stream will be ignored completely

member.name: M:Nest.WatcherClientExtensions.WatcherAckWatch(Elasticsearch.Net.IElasticsearchClient,System.String,System.Func{Nest.AcknowledgeWatchRequestParameters,Nest.AcknowledgeWatchRequestParameters})
member.summary:
Represents a PUT on /_watcher/watch/{id}/_ack
Returns: ElasticsearchResponse<T> holding the response body deserialized as DynamicDictionary
- Dynamic dictionary is a special dynamic type that allows json to be traversed safely
- i.e result.Response.hits.hits[0].property.nested["nested_deeper"]
- can be safely dispatched to a nullable type even if intermediate properties do not exist
See also: http://www.elastic.co/guide/en/watcher/current/appendix-api-ack-watch.html
member.param: Watch ID

Optional function to specify any additional request parameters
Querystring values, connection configuration specific to this request, deserialization state.
